source_sentence: 身髓布施不可稱計(出彌勒所問本願經)。
translation: His donation of marrow cannot be calculated (from the Sutra of the Former Vows of Maitreya's Questions).

source_sentence: 為王太子身出血施病人十四
translation: He gave blood from his body to the sick person for the king's princely son.14
Ānanda.
When I originally sought the path, my efforts and hardships were countless.
In a past life, I was the king's prince.
He was called the Princely One.
He was well-arranged and beautiful.
He emerged from the garden observation.
He saw a man on the path.
He was suffering from a serious illness.
He met the patient and asked him.
"What medicine will he use to treat your illness?
The patient replied.
'Only the king's blood will heal me.'

source_sentence: 太子即以利刀刺身出血以與病者。
translation: The prince then stabbed him with a sharp knife and bled from his body and gave it to the sick man.
He wholeheartedly gave it to him with no remorse.
"The prince is myself.
Ānanda.
The four great waters of the ocean can still be measured in pounds.
There's no limit to the amount of blood I can give from my body.

source_sentence: 求正覺故(出彌勒所問本願經)。
translation: It's because we seek to achieve perfect enlightenment (from the Sutra of the Former Vows of Maitreya's Questions).
Sutra and Vinaya: Different Aspects, Volume 10
